title: You Sound a Little Tense: L2 Tailored Clear TTS Using Durational Vowel Properties
author: Paige Tuttosí (Simon Fraser University), H. Henny Yeung (Simon Fraser University), Yue Wang (Simon Fraser University), Jean-Julien Aucouturier (SUPMICROTECH, CNRS), Angelica Lim (Simon Fraser University), ...
relevance_why: This paper explores enhancements to text-to-speech systems, specifically for second language speakers, using vowel duration to improve intelligibility. This aligns well with Haohe's interest in audio and music processing.
background: The task involves improving text-to-speech synthesis for second language (L2) speakers by utilizing differences in vowel duration to enhance comprehensibility.
contribution: This paper introduces a clarity mode in text-to-speech synthesis tailored for L2 speakers, which significantly reduces transcription errors and is perceived as more respectful and encouraging.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods typically employed uniform slowing down of speech or emphasized all difficult words, which did not leverage linguistically relevant cues.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work specifically modifies the duration of tense vowels without affecting lax vowels, providing a more effective and natural form of speech synthesis for L2 listeners.

key_innovation: Focuses on adapting speech synthesis through targeted vowel duration modifications rather than general speech rate adjustments, enhancing clarity for L2 users.
real_world_impact: The proposed clarity mode could lead to advancements in voice technology applications for L2 speakers, improving their interactions with automated systems in daily life.

new_terms.clarity mode: **Clarity mode** is a feature in text-to-speech systems that modifies speech parameters specifically for the enhancement of intelligibility among second language speakers.
new_terms.lax/tens vowels: **Lax and tense vowels** are articulatory categories of vowels based on their pronunciation duration and intensity, affecting how L2 speakers perceive sounds.

open_sourcing: Clarity mode implemented in Matcha-TTS system is open-source.
